title: AEW Dynamite & Collision results , live blog : Full Gear go home
body_text:
Here’s a place to check results and comment along with a new episode of AEW Dynamite, airing live tonight (Nov. 19) at 8 p.m. ET on TBS... and streaming on HBO Max!
AEW Dynamite & Collision results, live blog (Nov. 19, 2025): Full Gear go home
Follow along with the supersized final push to Saturday’s PPV here!
AEW is in Boston’s Agganis Arena for a three-hour show they’re calling this week’s Dynamite AND Collision, although there’s also a one-hour Tailgate Blitz special that will air Saturday on TNT at 7 p.m. ET. That’s an extra pre-show though, so tonight will put most of the finishing touches on Sunday’s Full Gear PPV! Get ready with our preview here!
Set for the show: Interim ROH Women’s TV champion Mercedes “13 Belts” Moné will face ROH Women’s TV champion Red Velvet in a unification match, while AEW Unified champion Kazuchika Okada and CMLL World Trios champion Máscara Dorada have a Double Jeopardy match that will earn the winner a shot at the loser’s title!
There will also be two Women’s Tag Title Tournament matches, pitting Timeless Love Bombs (Timeless Toni Storm & Mina Shirakawa) against Alex Windsor & Riho and TayJay (Tay Melo & Anna Jay) against Megan Bayne & Marina Shafir, and Hangman Page faces The Opps’ Katsuyori Shibata ahead of his showdown with Samoa Joe this weekend. Plus, the first two men in Saturday’s Casino Gauntlet for the new National championship will be determined by Bobby Lashley vs. Ricochet and Speedball Mike Bailey vs. Shelton Benjamin… and more!
Come right back here at 8 p.m. Eastern when the Dynamite (and Collision) live blog kicks off once the show starts on TBS — and HBO Max. It will be below this line here.
Enjoy the show!
AEW DYNAMITE & COLLISION RESULTS AND LIVE BLOG FOR NOV. 19
Here’s a new dance craze that’s sweeping the nation, it’s called the toxic waltz and it’s causing devastation. You’re jumping up and down like a psycho circus clown, but me? I’m just here to liveblog this pro wrestling show for these folks.
The Demand make their entrance for our opener and Ricochet has some things he wants to say.
He starts out with “Fly Eagles Fly” and teases the locals about their football team and says the only good thing to come out of Massachusetts is his beautiful wife, and he needs to clear the air. A few weeks ago he was talking to Tony Khan and he was surprised Ariel Helwani didn’t ask TK about Montel Vontavious Porter.
He says MVP is getting old and has demential and misspoke the name of the AEW National Championship, of which he is going to be the first champion. He steamrolls “Shut the fuck up!” chants and says once he’s champion the fans are going to give him the respect he deserves and he’ll be flying high with his homies GOA and nobody can stop him from fulfilling his quest for gold.
Finally Bobby Lashley gets sick of hearing him talk… AND HE CHUCKS RICOCHET CLEAN OVER THE ROPES AND INTO THE GATES OF AGONY! Around the way, Bob lands the Pounce and then lays out Bishop Kaun and puts Toa Liona over the timekeeper’s barricade to the delight of MVP!
Bobby Lashley vs. Ricochet
Winner gets to enter the Casino Gauntlet Match at Full Gear first.
Finally starting inside, Ricochet mounts a comeback, Jumbo knee and a pair of kicks, standing shooting star press, diving moonsault, only two! Charging in with Spirit Gun, Lashley counters and chokeslams him hard! Off the ropes…
Bobby Lashley wins by pinfall with the spear, earning the #1 spot in the AEW National Championship Casino Gauntlet Match at Full Gear.
Samoa Joe and Katsuyori Shibata are backstage.
Joe cuts a promo on Hangman Page saying his only solace is that Page’s whole world of comfort is going to get very different very fast, because he is guilty of crimes and transgressions against the Opps, and his punishment starts tonight in the form of Shibata. Deadly by design, violent by intention, and firmly intent on bringing Hanger to justice for what he did to “Powerhouse” Will Hobbs.
Renee Paquette interviews the Young Bucks backstage.
Before they can speak, Don Callis rolls up to tell her to leave them alone and tells the Bucks to show everyone why they’re the best tag team on the planet and they’ll answer questions after.
Josh Alexander & Young Bucks (Matt & Nick Jackson) vs. SkyFlight (Dante Martin, Darius Martin, & Scorpio Sky)
Dante and Matt to start, feeling out, duck under, both men go for dropkicks and kip up to stalemate! Tags made, Darius and Josh, Alexander rolls him through for a big waistlock takedown, whip to the corner, big elbow, Martin cuts him off with a dropkick! Uppercut into the corner, Dante tags back in, Awesome Clothesline, quick tags, somersault senton, slingshot splash from Sky!
Matt runs in, Manhattan Drop to an assisted facebreaker to a belly-to-belly suplex over the ropes and to the floor! Nick on the apron, superkicks and shoulder blocks, slingshot X-Factor takes Scorpio out and an Asai moonsault for Darius! Wrecking ball dropkick from Matt takes Dante out, Sky tries to take the Bucks out but Josh low-bridges him to the floor and we go to break!
Back from commercial, Sky gets a schoolboy on Alexander, tag to Darius, clear the apron, up and over, standing Spanish Fly, suicide dive takes the Bucks out, back in with a boot, jumping reverse STO… NO DEAL! Top Flight with a moonsault / powerbomb combination… THE YOUNG BUCKS BREAK IT UP!
Bucks holding court, cutting Top Flight out of the air with Superkick Parties, BTE Trigger countered into a double noggin knocker! Dante Martin lands a huge tope con giro! Springboard crossbody back inside, cover for two! Ankle lock from Alexander, Martin fights out of it, Matt comes in, sidestep, Alexander cuts him off and the Bucks hit the Meltzer Driver!
Josh picks Dante’s leg and falls back into the grapevined ankle lock while the Bucks run interference…
Josh Alexander & Young Bucks win by submission with an ankle lock from Alexander on Dante Martin.
Post-match, Don Callis and several members of the Family get in the ring and says the world is watching and waiting for the Young Bucks to make the official announcement that they’re joining the Don Callis Family.
The Bucks hesitate and Don says he gets it, they’re nervous and he reminds them that he’s got the money flowing for them and it’s in their best interest to join, so just announce it for the people. They still hesitate and he says AEW is dangerous and he’d hate to see what happened to Kenny Omega happen to them. Speak of the devil…
Enter Kenny Omega, chair in hand.
He wallops Rocky Romero and Mark Davis and slides into the ring to brawl with Josh Alexander while the Bucks huddle in the corner. They advance and pull Kenny off of Josh and Alexander comes in with a chop block and puts the ankle lock on Omega! The Bucks are conflicted and Callis orders Josh to let go because he has something in better in mind.
He wants the Bucks to show they’re joining the Family by giving Ken the ol’ BTE Trigger! Callis gets a kick in of his own waiting for them to get going. The Young Bucks circle around while Omega recovers and begs off. They grab wristlocks…
JURASSIC EXPRESS ARE HERE! JUNGLE MAN HAS A SHOVEL AND LUCHASAURUS HAS A VACUUM CLEANER!
Babes of Wrath are interviewed backstage.
They talk about the tag title tournament and how they’re going to win.
Commentary takes a moment to eulogize Bob Caudle, Tony Schiavone talking specifically about what it meant to work with him, microphone to microphone, back in 1985 and putting him over as a great person and a first-ballot commentary hall of famer.
A memorial graphic goes up and we go to break.
“Speedball” Mike Bailey vs. Shelton Benjamin
Winner gets the number two spot in the Casino Gauntlet Match at Full Gear.
Montel Vontavious Porter is on commentary for this one.
Bailey ducks under, big chop, Benjamin throws them in the corner but Speedball turns right back around with chest kicks! Big knee from Shelton, throwing Mike to the floor after! Following out after, Benjamin grabs them and throws them back inside, bridging victory roll pin from Bailey!
Following it up with La Casita, blasting Shelton to the floor with a boot, suicide dive… COUNTERED WITH A MICHINOKU DRIVER ON THE FLOOR TO SEND US THE BREAK!
Back from commercial, Benjamin with a nearfall, reverse chinlock to grind Bailey down as MVP likens Shelton to a big cat, playing with his food. Bailey gets out, laying kicks in, shooting star press only gets one! More chest kicks, Benjamin gets back to his feet, palm strikes from Mike, flying armbar connects but they can’t get full extension on the arm… SHELTON WITH THE DEADLIFT POWERBOMB COUNTER AND THEY BOTH SPILL TO THE FLOOR!
Referee Paul Turner issues his count, Bailey pulls Benjamin back down but Shelton returns the favor twice over! Grabbing Speedball by the party in the back… POWERBOMB COUNTERED WITH A FRANKENSTEINER INTO THE BARRICADE! DDT ON THE FLOOR RIGHT AFTER! Turner breaks his count to check on them and restarts as Mike heads back inside.
Shelton joins them, shooting star press off the top… STILL NO! Moonsault double knees, cover for two and right back into the cross armbar! HUGE WILD TOSSING T-BONE SUPLEX CONNECTS! Bailey right back on their feet, schoolboy for two, big superkick… SPEEDBALL WON’T STAY DOWN! MVP gets in the ring to argue with referee Paul Turner, Shelton with a German suplex, corner knee…
Shelton Benjamin wins by pinfall with a superkick, earning the #2 spot in the AEW National Championship Casino Gauntlet Match at Full Gear.
And so we go to break.
Death Riders (Claudio Castagnoli & Jon Moxley) vs. Orange Cassidy & Roderick Strong
Cassidy and Moxley brawling on the floor as Castagnoli and Strong go at it in the ring. To the floor, Roddy hammering chops on Claudio, Jon comes over and they trade partners, back inside and finally some order settles in as Moxley tags in. Elbows and chops, scraping Roddy’s face across the top rope, and the heat segment rolls on.
Cassidy returns to the ring, makes the tag, diving crossbody caught, rolled through, but Stundog Millionaire sends Castagnoli to the floor! Off the ropes, dive caught, Claudio with a military press, walking him over and dropping him face-first into the barricade! Uppercut for a knee for a big boot for an overhand chop, all four men brawling on the floor!
Orange on the barricade, hands in his pockets for a trust fall senton that wipes Death Riders out and sends us to break!
Back from commercial, Moxley nails Cassidy with an elbow, chops him into the corner, tag to Castagnoli. Claudio lights him up with rapid-fire uppercuts such that referee Bryce Remsburg has to pull him out of the corner! Jon with a cheap shot while Bryce is admonishing Castagnoli! Orange crawling for a tag, Claudio rolls him through, giant swing countered to a victory roll pin for two!
Uppercut for Cassidy, boot clears the apron, take two and the giant swing works this time, albeit only for three or four revolutions! Big DDT from Orange, crawling as Roderick gets back on the apron, and tags are made! Strong ducks under, leg lariat, clear the apron, lariat, wrecking ball dropkick, enzuigiri and chops and elbows put Moxley into the ropes!
Off the ropes, rights and lefts, back suplex facebuster, underhooks… GIBSON DRIVER FOR TWO AND INTO STRONG HOLD ON THE KICKOUT! Moxley wavers, Daniel Garcia runs interference, Roddy lets go and Jon nails him with the Paradigm Shift… ORANGE BREAKS IT UP! Claudio sends Orange to the floor with a Karelin lift, electric chair on Strong, he slips out!
Olympic Slam on Castagnoli, superplex takes Jon down out of the corner! Cassidy tags in, nails Danny with an Orange Punch, one for Moxley too! Wheeler YUTA on the apron, baiting Orange out to the floor and back in, Claudio is right there… SWISS DEATH! Mox puts him in the bulldog choke…
Death Riders win by submission with the bulldog choke from Jon Moxley on Orange Cassidy.
Post-match, Kyle O’Reilly comes screaming down to pick Moxley’s leg and try to break his damn ankle!
YUTA and Garcia attack but Kyle just smiles! He breaks after a bit but sits right back up and puts the ankle lock right back on! Death Riders finally manage to pull Jon to the safety of the floor but he’s screaming agony!
Kyle gets on the mic and says he wants Moxley at Full Gear and he wants a No Holds Barred Match! And just like at Blood and Guts, the history books are gonna say that Mox tapped out!
Brodido cut a promo on FTR.
They’ve proven that they’re one of the greatest tag teams in wrestling but they haven’t been able to prove that they can beat them, and they’re gonna keep the tag titles, because Brodido never stops fighting.
We see Mercedes Mone walking backstage in a lovely fur coat and gold sequined minidress, carrying two of her titles, and we go to break.
Back from commercial, Kenny Omega is backstage with Jurassic Express.
Omega says that they say money can’t buy family or friendship, but Don Callis and the Young Bucks proved that wrong, and he’s mad at Josh Alexander for hurting Kota Ibushi and Michael Nakazawa, and he tells Don to count his money because his time is coming, and until then, goodbye and goodnight, bang.
Alex Windsor & Riho vs. Timeless Love Bombs (Mina Shirakawa & Toni Storm) (AEW Women’s World Tag Team Championship Tournament First Round Match)
Shirakawa and Riho to start, Mina blasts her with a dropkick for one! Riho with a crossbody for one, Shirakawa with a lil shimmy, roll through, sweep the leg, trading pins for a stalemate! Tags made, test of strength, Windsor messing with her by switching hands over and over again before finally grabbing the knucklelocks!
Alex slips out, pin denied, side headlock from Toni, shot off, drop down, duck a back elbow, do-si-do, trading arm drags! Off the ropes, Windsor blasts her with a big elbow and tags Riho in! Backbreaker from Toni, tag to Mina, double whip, sliding flapjack sets up a dropkick, slingshot tornillo, cover for two!
Sending Toni and Mina to the floor, assisted crossbody from Riho and we go to break!
Back from commercial, Shirakawa on the wrong side of town, she gets away and tags Storm in! Uppercut and a series of snapmares on Windsor, punctuate with a big boot, tag to Mina, assisted tornillo for two! Grapevining the legs for a Romero Special, Shirakawa just stomps the knees! Figure four leglock blocked, buzzsaw roundhouse kick, Mina off the ropes, counter Blue Thunder Driver… SHIRAKAWA KICKS OUT!
Alex tags out and takes care of Toni on the floor, Riho off the top, nobody home, Mina blasts her with two uraken in a row! Figure four leglock applied in the middle of the ring, Riho sits up and slaps her before reversing the pressure! Toni intervenes to put it back, Alex does the same, Storm tries again but Windsor blocks so they trade strikes until they collapse and break the leglock up!
Mina and Riho hammering each other with elbows, Dragon suplex for two! Off the ropes, Shirakawa meets her with an elbow, cover for two, tags made! Alex wading in with chops, whip across, side Russian legsweep and a short lariat, back suplex follows, cover… NOPE! Down and out in the corner, Toni and Mina paste them with hip attacks, Storm hooks Windsor while Shirakawa sits on Riho’s face in the corner…
Timeless Love Bombs win by pinfall with Storm Zero from Toni Storm on Alex Windsor.
Mark Briscoe, Kyle Fletcher, and Don Callis are interviewed backstage.
Fletcher says he agreed to no disqualification because he’s supremely confident in his win record over Mark and he’s confident he’s going to break the record for most defenses in a single AEW TNT Championship title reign. He’s also excited to see how Briscoe thrives under a real family.
Mark tells him not to talk to him about family, because every time he steps in the ring he fights for his family and with his road family the Conglomeration, and he has no intentions of leaving that behind. So when he agreed to the stipulations he knoew that failure was not an option and he will not be leaving his family or letting them down.
Matter of fact, he’s gonna make his family proud when he walks through that door--
Kazuchika Okada and Hechicero jump Briscoe and hold him in place for Callis to say he’s gonna make Mark’s kids orphans. Kyle thanks Okada for not agreeing to no physicality and Kazuchika says he was happy to help.
And we go to break.
Back from commercial we get a PAC video package.
He says he’s been doing a lot of soul-searching and thinks he deserves Darby Allin an apology for promising him a broken neck and sending him to the burn ward instead, but maybe he did both, because nobody’s seen Allin since. At Blood and Guts maybe he took things too far, but if Darby still has that backbone, he wants him to answer the question.
He’s challenging him to a legitimate contest, no weapons, no cattle prod, no taser, no flamethrower, because stripped of his bells and whistles, there’s no way someone like Allin can compete with a legitimate athlete like him.
Samoa Joe makes his entrance to join the commentary team.
Hanger attacks Shibata during his entrance! He takes Katsuyori over to the timekeeper’s table and chokes him! Taking him to the announce desk in front of Joe for more beatdown, back inside and the bell rings and Shibata blasts him with a boot!
“Hangman” Adam Page vs. Katsuyori Shibata
Whipping Page barricade to barricade, setting a steel chair up on the floor, clubbing blows, setting him in it, charging but Adam pops up and cuts him off and puts his boot through Shibata’s skull! Throwing him back inside, kicks in the corner, Katsuyori turns things around with clubbing blows, uppercuts, side headlock but Adam counters with a backbreaker and cuffs him with a lariat!
To the floor, Shibata with a straight suplex to Samoa Joe’s delight and we go to break!
Back from commercial, Shibata laying vicious chops in, Page catches him and hits a fallaway slam! Kip-up, big right hands, passing Katsuyori to the floor, triangle lariat connects! Plancha follows, back inside, jockeying for position, big boot in the corner from Shibata! Backing off, hopping back over, Shibata kicks him high but legal on the inner thigh!
Hangman down in the corner, skins the cat to counter the hesitation dropkick, Buckshot out of the corner countered into a German suplex, land on his feet, back and forth, cross armbar from Shibata after a low blow! Page fighting, he gets his foot on the rope to force the break! Ankle lock applied, Page sheds his boot to get out of it!
He puts it back on, to the apron…
“Hangman” Adam Page wins by pinfall with Buckshot.
Thus ends Dynamite.
Collision begins with “Hangman” Adam Page in the ring standing over Katsuyori Shibata while Samoa Joe stares him down.
Hangman gets on the mic and tells Joe to look around him. He might be surrounded by thousands of crazy fans and sitting at the desk with commentary, Samoa is now alone. When he walks into the steel cage at Full Gear, he wants Joe to remember that he doesn’t have Will Hobbs because he send him to the hospital and he doesn’t have Shibata because he just sent him to [REDACTED], and most importantly he wants him to remember what happened the last time Page was locked in a steel cage with a man.
Because if he has to, he will do it again.
We get a promo from FTR.
Stokely Hathaway asks Brodido if anything they’ve done will hold up in nine years, and Cash Wheeler tells them to enjoy tonight, there’s no shenanigans, they’re not gonna attack Dick “the Dragon” Steamboat or anybody’s grandma. Dax Harwood says Saturday is important because it’s the match they’re going to build the next phase of their career on and ensure they go down as the best tag team of all time.
Marina Shafir & Megan Bayne vs. TayJay (Anna Jay & Tay Melo) (AEW Women’s World Tag Team Championship Tournament First Round Match)
Melo and Shafir to start, trading takedowns, Tay wading in with elbows but Shafir shrugs ‘em off and takes her down again. Whip reversed, Melo backs her into the corner with more elbows, tag to Jay, double suplex connects! Heel team takes control, Bayne tags in and takes TayJay out and we go to break!
Back from commercial, Melo in hot putting boots to Bayne, German suplex for Shafir, assisted German suplex on the Megasus! TayJay charging corner strikes, match breaking down, Anna blasts Bayne with a reverse STO and Tay hits a running knee, blockbuster from Jay… NO DEAL! Marina chokes Anna out…
Marina Shafir & Megan Bayne win by submission with a choke from Shafir on Anna Jay.
Post-match, Shafir keeps the hold on for a long beat and repeatedly kisses Anna’s forehead.
Timeless Love Bombs appear on the tron. Toni Storm says they’re gonna win the four-way at Full Gear and they could pick anything as the stipulation for their semifinal, a chicken coop match or apartment wrestling or, Mina adds, a Taipei Deathmatch.
Kris Statlander cuts a promo on Mercedes Mone about her lack of focus ahead of their match at Full Gear and we go to break.
Back from commercial, Bang Bang Gang cut a promo backstage about the $200,000 Tailgate Brawl four-way match they’re in on Saturday. “Rock Hard” Juice Robinson is focused on the money and how he’s gonna invest it so they’re gonna be rich.
Kazuchika Okada vs. Mascara Dorada
This is a Double Jeopardy match, which is to say the winner gets a shot at the loser’s championship— Okada’s AEW Unified Championship or either of Dorada’s CMLL World Historic Welterweight Championship or the CMLL World Trios Championship he holds as a member of Sky Team.
Don Callis is on commentary for this one.
Collar and elbow, struggling into the ropes, Okada breaks clean with a pat on the chest. Circling, back to the lockup, Kazuchika cuts him down with elbows! Off the ropes, leapfrogs, back roll la casadora blocked, backflip, knucklelock, Dorada steps up, balances, Arabian Press fakeout and he takes Okada down!
Mascara off the ropes, nobody home, fakeout taunt, Kazuchika playing mindgames and Dorada gets frustrated, kicks a rope, and leads the crowd in chanting “Bitch!” at Okada! Break the count, shove Mascara into the barricade, back inside, off the ropes, big dive wipes Kazuchika out! Dropkick sends Dorada back out to the floor and we go to break!
Back from commercial, Dorada with a gamengiri, he about slips off the turnbuckles but still hits the diving DDT on the apron! Back inside, monkey flip and a Frankensteiner, Mascara is hurting, Okada to the floor and Dorada lands a huge suicide tornillo! Ace Crusher over the barricade, diving Frankensteiner, Mascara in control!
Back inside, Okada cuts him off, scoop and a slam, diving elbow drop, snap zoom flip the bird, backslide no deal, dropkick right on the button! Drawing Mascara up, Rainmakre countered, rolling sunset flip… SO CLOSE! Charging in the corner, Dorada puts him up top, enzuigiri, electric chair, double pumphandle slam!
Mascara off the top, 450 splash… STILL NO! Okada takes him off the top, Dorada catches him out of nowhere with a small package! Kazuchika with a Falcon Arrow and a wristlock…
Kazuchika Okada wins by pinfall with a Rainmaker, earning a shot at one of Mascara Dorada’s championships.
Post-match, Don Callis gets on the mic and crows about what a great win for the Family this is and makes official their challenge for the CMLL World Trios Championship.
The match will be at Full Gear and will feature a Don Callis Family Dream Team of Kazuchika Okada, Hechicero, and Konosuke Takeshita.
Okada is visibly none too pleased to be teaming with Takeshita again.
Renee Paquette interviews the Sisters of Sin backstage.
They talk about the Babes of Wrath’s sins, obviously wrath, but also pride, and their third sin is them. Thekla rolls up to talk about what sick, twisted stuff they’re gonna come up with as a stipulation when they win the four-way.
Kris Statlander makes her entrance to send us to break.
Mercedes Mone (i) vs. Red Velvet (c) (ROH Women’s World Television Championship Unification Match)
Kris Statlander is on commentary for this one.
Feeling out, off the ropes, la casadora into a victory roll pin by Velvet, whip across, crossbody headlock takeover, both women go for dropkicks and come up empty! Red piefaces Mone, body blows in the corner, to the floor, Mercedes takes control and waves some of her titles in Statlander’s face.
Back to Velvet, brawling, Mone throws her into Kris Stat! Back inside, Statlander on the apron, Red does an Eddy Guerrero Special! Referee Aubrey Edwards isn’t buying it despite Mercedes holding a title, but it’s good for Velvet to get a nearfall as we go to break!
Back from commercial, Velvet counters a slam with a crossbody for two! Off the ropes with a shove, la casadora bulldog, double knees in the ropes, bouncing Mercedes off of them, cover for two! Mone outta nowhere with the Statement Maker, wrenching it way back, Red counters with a short armscissors!
Mercedes counters with a pin, hold broken, Velvet ducking and dodging, laying kicks in, Mone catches one and returns the favor! Red lands a vicious German suplex, rolling solebutt, lateral press for two! Velvet follows it up with an octopus hold, reversed, Tombstone Codebreaker… NO DEAL!
Red mounted punches in the corner, avalanche victory roll driver… SO CLOSE! Mone fighting back with back elbows, counter the Tombstone, setting Mercedes up top, jockeying for position… AVALANCHE TOMBSTONE CODEBREAKER AND IT IS OVER!
Mercedes Mone wins by pinfall with an avalanche Tombstone Codebreaker, becoming the Undisputed ROH Women’s World Television Champion.
Post-match, Mone climbs on the announce desk to celebrate and throws the title at Kris Statlander! Jumping down she locks the Statement Maker in and tells Kris that her title is hers!
That’s the show, folks.
